entry.title: Teaberry Chewing Gum
entry.summary:
Vendor: Gerrit J. Verburg Co.
Type: Candy
Price: 1.49

Time for a Blast to the Past

     Put on your nostalgia goggles, this minty-fresh gum is taking us back! Originally developed by Charles Burke who experimented with different flavours of his gum from his basement, the patent was then bought by the D.L. Clark Company.

    Clark's Teaberry surged in popularity after an ad campaign in the 1960s. Using the tune "The Mexican Shuffle" from Tijuana Brass, Clark got Herb Alpert to rerecord it as "The Teaberry Shuffle". The commercials it was featured in showed uptight folk who would then chew a bit of Teaberry gum, and begin breaking out in dance!  

     This gum gets its flavour (and name) from the Gaultheria procumbens, better known as the eastern teaberry. The taste is reminiscent of a milder wintergreen mint. And you probably thought you weren't going to learn anything today, huh?

Enjoy the refreshing taste of yesterday, today!

 

20g

entry.title: Black Jack Gum Tin - 4.40oz
entry.summary:
Vendor: Gerrit J. Verburg Co.
Type: Candy
Price: 9.99

Black Jack Gum Tin

Beemans Chewing gum was invented by Dr. Edward Beeman of Ohio in the 1890s when he added pepsin powder to chicle and created the one and only Beemans Pepsin Chewing Gum. It was made famous by Chuck Yeager who chewed it before every flight for good luck. Beemans gum was sold for more than 90 years before being discontinued in 1978, only to be brought back to the market in 1985 and again in 2005 as a limited-edition nostalgia product. Now it's back again for a Limited Time Only!

 

4.40 oz

Bazooka Bubble Gum is a brand we all know and love. But did you know you can still buy it in its original packaging? That's what you'll get here with Bazooka Throwback Original Bubble Gum.

Bazooka Bubble Gum first hit the market in the 1940s. It's been part of most of our childhoods, and chances are you remember buying handfuls of single Bazooka bubble gum at the neighborhood corner store during the summer with friends.
